tweets.text:
‚ÄúWorst smell in Britain‚Äù-respect @theJeremyVine for coming & smelling the landfill himself & openly stating how bad it is. @DefraGovUK we are not making this up-the @EnvAgency are failing us,pls step in&stop this environmental terrorism #stopthestink 

https://t.co/gjTm3xtfMT

urls.title: Jeremy Vine describes Walleys Quarry as 'worst smell in Britain' on BBC Radio 2
urls.description: The popular radio presenter explained to listeners how there had been 5,000 complaints about the quarry in the last month - with 2,000 last weekend

tweets.text: Vegetation clearance starts from tomorrow. A very short visit this am incl: nest building Whitethroat, territorial Cetti's/Reed Warbler & Reed Bunting. Video shows how farcical this is! Still time to see sense @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder  PLEASE RETWEET https://t.co/Tve0B6o4va

I don't usually do this sort of thing, but when it is on my local patch it really gets to me!! Scrub & tree removal in May is terrible practice. Please retweet. https://t.co/cYEIymHH0K Two videos showing the area & my concerns. @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice @EnvAgency @kiergroup https://t.co/U8doUyBP5K

Excited to announce that the #BeFloodReady south-west Property Flood Resilience (PFR) demonstration centre will be hosted @heartlandsuk World Heritage site. Learn more about our plans for this interactive PFR demonstration space in our latest newsletter:
https://t.co/J95VO0HCAx https://t.co/C1vp28JkqJ

tweets.text: @SianieRoo @theJeremyVine @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency Another sickening night at hands of @RedIndustries2 now walleys quarry, still got headache & 12 hrs later house still stinks & that's with the windy conditions @CareDinnisEA are you allowing this to happen tonight or evacuating us to place with clean air where we can sleep?
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StaffordshireCC @NewsNBC @RedIndustries2 I'm sure I can guess.....Nothing whatsoever. Gutless EA.

@PHE_WestMids @davemh72 @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe You have advised @EnvAgencyMids that the symptoms are transient and acceptable.But the odour is almost every night & gets trapped indoors,therefore dramatically increases exposure time. How is this accounted for? And what about mental health? #stopthestink

@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC Why not, instead of answering the easy questions, let us know if the capping has been completed as per the enforcement notice, or if waste collections has resumed at Walley‚Äôs Quarry? #stopthestink
Another exciting British rewilding project, the planned reintroduction of mighty sturgeon to our rivers after an absence of centuries. üëè https://t.co/L6b8frnLXX

Updated monthly and 12 monthly #rainfall for selected @EnvAgencyNW #Cumbria raingauges. A very dry April across the area. @gazettenewsdesk @cumbnews @c_wgazette @CWHerald @NWEMlive @timesandstar @KeswickReminder @WhitehavenNews @newsandstar @ITVborder @BBC_Cumbria @CumbriaCrack https://t.co/AeTQcUilN8

@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StaffordshireCC @NewsNBC What punishment are you going to hand out to @RedIndustries2 for failing to adhere to the enforcement notice on time?
More raw sewage, pouring into yet another of our lovely rivers. Why do we put up with this? https://t.co/IckIgM2G0X

@robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC Planning permission is local planning authority, here that's @StaffordshireCC but the env permit is @EnvAgencyMids 

There's more on responsibilities in the EA presentation to the @NewsNBC #scrutiny committee which you can find at the bottom of this https://t.co/Hz9p8O6J4n page
@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC Now's your opportunity @ClareDinnisEA to answer our questions truthfully. @StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

@JoP24048538 @GlavenEel @Christo1219 @EnvAgencyAnglia @AnglianWater Thanks Jo! Those two pumping stations would be the obvious potential sources. I'm no expert but foam + chemical/perfume odour + sewage is unlikely to be simply pastureland run-off.

Shame on you @RedIndustries2 The only thing you have succeeded in doing is poisoning families in Stoke on Trent and Staffordshire! Why on earth @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_WestMids and @BorisJohnson are you allowing this to carry on????? It is a disgrace!!! @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe https://t.co/8wDbfaxT1c

@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC Let me know @Tus_M_  if we get an answer as I have to go back to work now and all on about 6 hours sleep since Friday because of that cesspit. Thanks @ClareDinnisEA 

@StinkStopthe @Cap_it_off

@robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe Hi Rob, this is a condition specified in the @StaffordshireCC planning permission rather than the @EnvAgencyMids environmental permit. But my understanding is that it allows tipping between 07:00 & 19:00 on weekdays and 07:00 & 13:00 on Saturdays.
@Nicola_Carter_ @RewildingB @lakedistrictnpa @EnvAgency George Monbiot described sheep as "a woolly plague" on upland terrain. üêë

@GlavenEel @Christo1219 @EnvAgencyAnglia @AnglianWater Someone needs to check the source of the very large amounts of foam (distribute well over 1km downstream that day) and pervasive smell of raw sewage all along the Tiffey. Where is the nearest sewage outflow? It has to come from somewhere...
@alastairmci @EnvAgency 'local factors' like GB landmass continuing to rebound from the last ice age (?) lifting N Scotland up and dipping S England down?

@ClareDinnisEA @robbiedyson @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC Yes @ClareDinnisEA We've had the weekend from hell & I personally have had such bad heart palpitations from the toxic stench that I nearly ended up hospitalised. We haven't heard a peep out of you since your staged video & photo opportunity. Come on we need answers @StinkStopthe

@ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @StaffordshireCC I thought the permit was issued by Newcastle Borough Council  or am I wrong

Most projections for #SeaLevel rise - mainly #GlobalWarming but local factors too - project only to 2030, 2050 or 2100.

This UK, Welsh & Scottish government study (Aug 2019) is unusual. For infrastructure planning purposes, it projects to the year 2300: https://t.co/Zqqqf2EMhM https://t.co/6KAGAbZD9K

@davemh72 @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe PHE is NOT a regulatory body, therefore we have no statutory powers. Our role in this matter is to interpret the air quality monitoring data against global health guidance and give that information to the regulators - the Environment Agency and local authorities

@sharpebirder @Christo1219 @EnvAgencyAnglia Similar has happened a few times now.There seems to be discharge from the drain running down the side of the abbey into the Tiffey where the old weir was removed.Really Stinky grey water.Reported twice by Norfolk Rivers Trust.@AnglianWater say there is no connection to homes. https://t.co/HcNr9tjjqB
Are you listening yet? @ClintonDevon @EnvAgency @NESouthWest https://t.co/x5ZAl4DoPj

@ladyhort8 @WychwoodGardens @InsideDevon @DevonLiveNews @DevonCC @defra @The_RHS @EnvAgency @recycle_now Clearly more nurseries or garden centres should start using #POSIpots! Plus lots of online nurseries deliver #plasticfree nowadays.

@ladyhort8 @WychwoodGardens @InsideDevon @DevonLiveNews @DevonCC @defra @The_RHS @EnvAgency @recycle_now Every one of those pots is fully recyclable. Horticulture is trying hard. Coloured pots are becoming standard after recyclers blame black pots as the problem. The recycling industry need to do better & so do the local authorities too.
@ladyhort8 @InsideDevon @DevonLiveNews @DevonCC @defra @The_RHS @EnvAgency @recycle_now Should in this day an age, all pots should be made recyclable and not single use.

Thank you @talkRADIO The host seemed genuinely shocked about how we are living. It is shocking and should not be tolerated in this day and age! It is dangerous! evidence of children suffering from this locallyüëá. @EnvAgency are negligent by allowing this to happen  #stopthestink https://t.co/w4s4K34cfV https://t.co/i2FYNCOhKL

The Roding is London's 3rd largest river, but has one of the highest concentrations of sewer overflows.
It looks like the infrastructure is buckling  but Thames Water won't tell us if their sewers can't cope.
It truly is treated like a drain

https://t.co/l8Hd7on1J8 https://t.co/5Kz00Iv1Ra
